remarks: Define the collection of "GCH-sets", or sets for which the generalized continuum hypothesis holds.  In this language the generalized continuum hypothesis can be expressed as ` GCH = _V ` .  A set ` x ` satisfies the generalized continuum hypothesis if it is finite or there is no set ` y ` strictly between ` x ` and its powerset in cardinality.  The continuum hypothesis is equivalent to ` _om e. GCH ` .  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 15-May-2015.)
statement:
df-gch $p |- GCH = ( Fin u. { x | A. y -. ( x ~< y /\ y ~< ~P x ) } ) $.
$d x y $.
